intro: Calonyction tuboides, commonly known as the Cape golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a low-growing perennial that produces bright yellow flowers in late spring and early summer. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine, woolly coating. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
